author: Barry K
title: ​5 Terrific Scenes From Bill Paxton’s Badass Acting Career
text:
1/5 Challenging Arnold Schwarzenegger—The Terminator 
Paxton, rocking giant blue spikes in his hair and tire tracks down his face, was the brashest of the street punks to take it to Arnold in The Terminator. “Nice night for a walk, eh?” kicks off all the action, and a couple choice eff-bombs turn the title character into Kill Mode. 2/5 Game Over, Man—Aliens You’d react the same way if you were fighting an army of acid-spitting alien predators. This is one of the most indelible lines from one of the 1980s’ best actioners. 3/5 Navigating the Core—Twister Not many actors are asked to drive a speeding truck through the core of a storm while dodging flying cows. Bill Paxton did it. This means immortality. 4/5 Spits Out His Gum—Apollo 13 “…Thanks.” Paxton says four words in this tiny suit-up scene, and man, he’s great in it. His eyes look alert and anxious. His jaw looks ready. His eyebrows cock and his mouth moves from surprise to small smile to set determination in seconds. It’s such a wonderful acting moment. It’s the perfect case-in-point for Paxton’s excellence. 5/5 Kentucky—Edge of Tomorrow As the profane, no-nonsense Master Sergeant Farell, Paxton dished out orders with lyrical dexterity. His intro with Tom Cruise here is note-perfect, and a fitting summation of his wider film career.
